title: 111_hr101
content: The "Economic Recovery Through Responsible Homeownership Act of 2009" includes a refundable credit for residences purchased during 2009 or 2010 under section 36A of the Internal Revenue Code. The "Economic Recovery Through Responsible Homeownership Act of 2009" offers a tax credit for eligible purchases based on down payment percentages, with varying applicable amounts. The tax credit for eligible purchases of residences in the United States must meet specific criteria, including the start of construction before 2009 and the purchase being made in 2009 or 2010. No credit is allowed if the taxpayer has already claimed a first-time homebuyer credit under other sections. The tax credit for eligible residence purchases in the United States has specific criteria, including construction starting before 2009 and purchase in 2009 or 2010. The credit is not allowed if the taxpayer has claimed a first-time homebuyer credit under other sections. Other rules apply for related persons and married individuals filing separate returns. Rules similar to section 26 apply for reporting and recapture of credit, with adjustments in percentages and timeframes.
